1.text: Be ye imitators of me, as I also of Christ.

2.text: And I approve you, brethren, that ye remember me in all things, and as I have delivered to you, do ye hold the traditions.

3.text: And I will you to know, that the head of every man is Christ; and the head of the woman the man; and the head of Christ God.

4.text: Every man praying or prophesying, having on the head, shames his head.

5.text: And every woman praying or prophesying with head uncovered shames her head: for it is one and the same to her having been shaved.

6.text: For if the woman is not covered, let her also be shorn: and if shameful to the woman to be shorn or shaven, let her be covered.

7.text: For truly the man ought not to have the head covered, being the image and glory of God: and the woman is the glory of the man.

8.text: For the man is not of the woman; but the woman of the man.

9.text: For also the man was not created through the woman; but the woman through the man.

10.text: Therefore the woman ought to have power upon the head for the angels.

11.text: But neither the man without the woman, nor the woman without the man, in the Lord.

12.text: For as the woman by the man, so also the man by the woman; and all things of God.

13.text: Judge in yourselves: is it suitable for a woman to pray to God uncovered?

14.text: Does not nature itself teach you, that, if a man truly have long hair, it is a dishonour to him?

15.text: And if a woman have long hair, it is a glory to her: for the hair has been given her for a cloak.

16.text: And if any one seem to be loving strife, we have no such custom, neither the churches of God.

17.text: And this announcing I approve not, that not for the better come ye together, but for the worse.

18.text: For truly first, ye coming together in the church, I hear divisions to be among you; and some part I believe.

19.text: For there must be also sects among you, that the tried might be made manifest among you.

20.text: Therefore ye coming together upon the same, it is not to eat the Lord’s supper.

21.text: For each takes his own supper in eating: and one is truly hungry, and one is intoxicated.

22.text: For, have ye not houses for eating and drinking? or despise ye the church of God, and shame them not having? What should I say to you? shall I praise you in this? I praise not.

23.text: For I received from the Lord what I also delivered to you, That the Lord Jesus, in the night which he was delivered up, took bread:

24.text: And having given thanks, he brake, and said, Take ye, eat; this is my body, broken for you: this do ye for my remembrance.

25.text: Likewise the cup also, after supping, This cup is the new covenant in my blood: this do ye, as often as ye drink, for my remembrance.

26.text: For as often as ye eat this bread, and drink this cup, ye announce the Lord’s death till he come.

27.text: Therefore whoever should eat this bread, and drink the cup of the Lord, unworthily, shall be liable to the penalty of the body and blood of the Lord.

28.text: And let a man try himself, and so eat of the bread, and drink of the cup.

29.text: For he eating and drinking unworthily, eats and drinks judgment to himself, not discerning the Lord’s body.

30.text: For this many among you weak and sick, and enough are asleep.

31.text: For if we examined ourselves, we should not be judged.

32.text: And being judged, we are corrected of the Lord, lest we be condemned with the world.

33.text: Therefore, my brethren, coming together to eat, succeed one another.

34.text: And if any hunger, let him eat in the house; lest ye come together for judgment. And the rest when I come I will regulate.
